data_table.description: Leptin, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, and Omni 2, Exam 1. Please see flag variable in order to use the correct subset of data.

variable.name: plate
variable.description: ELISA Plate ID that sample was run on
variable.comment: PLATE variable indicates date the plate was run as well as the initials of the Tech who ran it. If there was more than 1 plate run on a specific day by the same Tech, it is delineated by an A or B.

variable.name: res1
variable.description: Leptin result for first well(sample type: serum)

variable.name: res2
variable.description: Leptin result for second well(sample type: serum)

variable.name: cvper
variable.description: Percent CV for those run in duplicate
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: leptin
variable.comment: Means for the individual flag groups are as follows:232.40 - 110348.30 for flag = 1609.30 - 79997.00 for flag = 2631.10 - 102964.60 for flag = 34181.04 - 6163.50 for flag = 4 For flag = 1, 2 or 3, LEPTIN is the same as RES1 regardless of whether the sample was done in duplicate or not. For flag = 4, LEPTIN is the mean of RES1 and RES2 because all controls were done in duplicate.

variable.name: flag
variable.comment: When doing analysis, use flag = 1 and 2. Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. When looking at phantom samples, use flag = 3 records as well as their corresponding FHS ID number in either flag = 1 or 2.
variable.value: FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in singleton
FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in duplicate

variable.name: phantom_id
variable.comment: Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. Those records with a blank PHANTOM_ID are not phantom samples. Blank = Missing.
